page.title: 15The Gravel Pit
page.content:
Our group made a visit to the gravel pit off Dymchurch Road. This is how the gravel is processed. First the gravel is dug out and put in barges, which take the gravel to the first washing machine to rinse. The gravel is then taken up a conveyor belt to be washed thoroughly. The gravel then goes up another conveyor belt to the screen house where the gravel is sorted into different sizes. These sizes are under 5mm, 5_10mm, 10_20mm and 20_40mm.
There are approximately 80_90 thousand tons of gravel dug in a year. Most of the gravel is used for cement but a small proportion is used for roadworks. When the gravel has been processed it is taken away in lorries to a radius of 15 miles.
